ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The Odra-Vistula Flood Management Project Coordination Unit in Wrocław

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The Odra-Vistula Flood Management Project Coordination Unit in Wrocław

TITLE.P: A concept for implementing the FRMP in the Upper Vistula sub-basin in terms of prioritization of investments, including flood protection of the city of Kraków

SHORT_DESCR.P: The purpose of the Service to be provided by the selected consultant will be to prepare documentation entitled “A concept for implementing the FRMP in the Upper Vistula sub-basin in terms of prioritization of investments, including flood protection of the city of Kraków”.

In this tender process, the concept should be understood as the development of strategic actions as provided for in the Flood Risk Management Plan (FRMP) for the Little Vistula (Mała Wisła) and the Upper Vistula (Górna Wisła) sub-basin, including identification of necessary investments.
The scope of services is described in detail in the Terms of Reference which are available at the following website www.odrapcu.pl, bookmark: Advertisements.

MAIN_SITE.P: Catchment Area of the Upper Vistula.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Government of the Republic of Poland has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Odra-Vistula Flood Management Project (OVFMP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services.

The said consulting services (“the Services”) will be provided to the Odra-Vistula Flood Management Project Coordination Unit (PCU) in Wrocław under a consulting contract signed by the PCU with the selected Consultant.

The purpose of the Service to be provided by the selected consultant will be to prepare documentation entitled “A concept for implementing the FRMP in the Upper Vistula sub-basin in terms of prioritization of investments, including flood protection of the city of Kraków”.

In this tender process, the Concept should be understood as the development of strategic actions as provided for in the Flood Risk Management Plan (FRMP) for the Little Vistula (Mała Wisła) and the Upper Vistula (Górna Wisła) sub-basin, including identification of necessary investments.
The scope of services was described in detail in the Terms of Reference that is available on the following website http://www.odrapcu.pl/ tab: Advertisements.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The Odra-Vistula Flood Management Project Coordination Unit in Wrocław now invites eligible consulting firms (“Consultants”) to indicate their interest in providing the Services. Interested Consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services.
The shortlisting criteria are:
1) Experience in preparing studies, concepts or multi-option programs/analyses for hydraulic/flood protection projects in accordance with the requirements of both Polish and EU.
2) Experience in preparing Feasibility Studies for hydraulic/flood protection projects
3) Experience in development of hydrological and/or hydraulic models being elements of studies, concepts or multi-option programs/analyses for hydraulic/flood protection projects
4) Experience in planning and preparation of large water management projects.
The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 1.9 of the World Bank’s Guidelines:

— selection and Employment of Consultants under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers, January 2011, revised July 2014 (“Consultant Guidelines”), setting forth the World Bank’s policy on conflict of interest.

Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications. In the case of a Joint Venture (JV), in order to create a short list, all members of the JV will be evaluated jointly and should be jointly and severally liable for the assignment and sign the contract if it is awarded to this JV. In their Expression of Interest (EOI), the Consultants should, separately for each member of the Joint Venture, present information on their experience and qualifications. Interested Consultants should clearly specify the form of cooperation and indicate in their application the obligations of the JV partners and sub-consultants.

Any unclear wording in the Expression of Interest, containing phrases such as “jointly with” and/as well as “in association with”, etc., may be the reason for not including the Consultants in the short-list.

The rule is that any firm submits one expression of interest in which it indicates whether it is participating as a sub-consultant, an individual consultant or a Joint Venture partner. One should remember that a consulting firm may submit only one EOI in the same selection process, either individually or as a Joint Venture partner. None of the firms that have submitted an EOI as an individual consultant or a Joint Venture member may be a sub-consultant in the same selection process. A firm participating as a sub-consultant or a Joint Venture member may participate with other consultants, but only as sub-consultant.

A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality- and Cost-Based Selection method set out in the Consultant Guidelines. Payments under this assignment will be made based on a lump-sum contract.
Further information can be provided at the following address within working hours i.e. from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.
Expression of interests must be submitted in writing to the following address (personally, by mail, fax or via e-mail immediately confirmed in writing) until 25th of January 2018.
The Odra-Vistula Flood Management.
Project Coordination Unit in Wrocław.
CC: Joanna Piątek-Glinkowska – Junior Procurement Specialist.
Al. Jaworowa 9-11.
53-123 Wrocław, Poland
— e-mail: pcu@odrapcu.pl
